message: I understand you wanting a larger share, but this is a fair offer considering the inflation we're dealing with. Let's close this deal and both benefit.
Considering the inflation, my share remains the same, but I'm willing to give you a bit more than before. Take it before the money devalues further.
Alice, let's be realistic.  I'm offering a perfectly even split.  Every round that passes hurts me more than you.  Let's end this now with a fair deal.
You're right, every round hurts you more, but I'm still willing to give you a decent share. This is as low as I'm willing to go.

Alice, this is getting ridiculous. I'm offering you a very favorable split considering the circumstances. Accept this now, or I'm going to start being much more aggressive to make up for the lost value.
I'm not intimidated by your threat. The longer we play, the more you lose. I'm still willing to give you a reasonable share, but don't expect me to go any lower.
Alice, this is my final offer.  The inflation means this is already a sacrifice for me. If you're serious about reaching a deal, you'll accept this. Otherwise, we'll both walk away with nothing.
You said that was your final offer, but I'm not buying it. I think you'll take what you can get at this point. This is my offer, take it or leave it.
Alice, this is it.  We're down to the wire.  Accept this offer - it's more than fair considering the circumstances - or we both get nothing. Don't be greedy.
I've been consistent in my offers, and you've been consistently rejecting them. I think you're bluffing about walking away. I'll give you one last chance to accept a reasonable offer.
